column4: i want to resize my image exact Pixels any Software for that in Ubuntu ?
gimp is a good image editor.
hey but it will not resize exact pixels
no? It resizes by pixel count when I last tried anyway.
u can try now i had tried
I tried yesterday and it could resize by pixel count then anyway. It could do that all the times I tried the past 5 years as well.
i had said it resize by pixel but i want exact pixel like 192 x 192 that it cant......! :)
I don't see why not, or you don't actually mean "resize" and mean something else.
its k bro......! but i had used word exact ... anyways .. Thanx bro for info. i ll take care of my words
I just scaled an image to 192x192 pixels in gimp.
k .... but what is the Procedure can u tell me .....!
imagemagick can do it from the command line.
you go to image->scale image, then you enter the amount of pixels you want there, and press scale (undo the "chain" if you dont want to keep aspect ratio)
so for installing imagemagick i have to type any cmd..
Hey Thanx for that Chain.. lol .. Finally done .
just a tip for you, you really should work on your "asking questions" skill, if it was the aspect ratio you didn't succeed in not keeping, saying so would have cut this conversation down by a lot.
saying "it won't resize to 192x192 but instead I can only choose one figure and it calculates the other" would also have worked.
see m bit noob may be .... but every one Starts from there so shortly i ll reach at some level
